description: [Greenpeace] In response to an analysis conducted by Center for International Environmental Law (CIEL) which revealed that 220 fossil fuel and chemical industry lobbyists, the highest at any negotiation so far analysed by CIEL, have gained access to the fifth session of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (INC5) to negotiate for a Global Plastics Treaty.
title: Africa: Greenpeace Africa Concerned By Lobbyists Flooding Plastics Treaty Negotiations

description: [allAfrica] Monrovia -- President Joe Biden's visit to Angola is intended to amplify how U.S. leadership impacted trade, investment, and Infrastructure in the region, and highlight the "remarkable evolution" of the U.S.-Angola relationship, senior White House officials said in an online briefing. Scheduled from December 2 to December 4, 2024, it will mark the outgoing president's first African visit.
title: Africa: Biden's Angola Trip 'Recognises How U.S. Prosperity is Tied to African Partners'

description: [New Times] The Regional Director elect of the World Health Organization (WHO) for Africa, Dr. Faustine Ndugulile, passed away early Wednesday morning while undergoing treatment in India.
title: Africa: WHO Africa Regional Boss Passes On

description: [ISS] Rather than seeking common African positions, prioritising Africa's development and peace can provide a foundation for meaningful global influence.
title: Africa: Africa's Foreign Policy Must Focus On Continental Needs

description: [GraÃ§a Machel Trust] On 25 November 2024, the Graça Machel Trust, hosted the Women Creating Wealth programme graduation ceremony at the Maslow Hotel in Rivonia, Sandton. This landmark event celebrated the success of 112 remarkable women entrepreneurs who completed the transformative Women Creating Wealth (WCW) enterprise development programme.
title: Africa: Women Creating Wealth Graduation - a Celebration of Resilience and Impact

description: [Business Day Africa] Farmer's Choice Limited has appointed Felisters Gitau as its new Chief Executive Officer, tapping into her extensive marketing and leadership experience to bolster the company's market presence and deepen consumer connections across the region.
title: Africa: Farmers Choice Names Financial Strategist As New CEO

description: [Daily Trust] The President of the Nigeria Golf Federation (NGF), Otunba Olusegun Runsewe has introduced a groundbreaking initiative in golf development with the launch of an online-based golf training program in Nigeria.
title: Africa: NGF President Launches Africa's First Online-Based Golf Training Programme

description: [State Department] SECRETARY BLINKEN:  Well, thank you.  Thank you.  It's wonderful to be here.  I've had the opportunity over many years to be engaged on behalf of the U.S. Government with the World Food Program.  The United States is very proud to be the leading contributor by far to the World Food Program, and I think it's a recognition of the fact that we see around the world, both in the places that you mentioned and so many other places, that on the one hand conflict is a
title: Africa: Secretary Antony J. Blinken at a Visit to World Food Program Headquarters Remarks

description: [USAID] United States Agency for International DevelopmentStatementAdministrator, Samantha PowerNovember 25, 2024
title: Africa: USAID Reaffirms Commitment to the Global Fight Against Gender-Based Violence in 16 Days of Activism

description: [U.S. Mission to the UN] On International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women and the start of the 16 Days of Activism, we reflect on the dire conditions that women and girls continue to face around the world. An astonishing one in three women worldwide has been subjected to gender-based violence (GBV).
title: Africa: United States Mission to the United Nations On International Women's Day

description: [State Department] Antony J. Blinken, Secretary of StateNovember 25, 2024
title: Africa: Observance of the International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women and 16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence Press Satement

description: [Daily News] Dodoma -- Former Member of Parliament for Kigamboni and Regional Director-elect of the World Health Organization (WHO) for Africa, Dr. Faustine Ndugulile, passed away early this morning while undergoing treatment in India.
title: Africa: WHO Africa Regional Director Dr Ndugulile Dies Aged 55

description: [Greenpeace] A flag with a giant eye composed of thousands of portraits from around the world, has been unfurled from a 10-storey crane as government representatives are gathering for the the fifth and final Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee (INC5) meeting for a Global Plastics Treaty.
title: Africa: At Decisive Plastics Treaty Talks, Greenpeace Africa Warns World Leaders - 'We Are Watching'

description: [UN News] With 2024 the deadliest year for aid workers on record, the Security Council must clearly condemn attacks against them and ensure accountability for perpetrators, a senior official with the UN humanitarian affairs office, OCHA, said on Tuesday.
title: Africa: Security Council Urged to Ensure Greater Protection of Humanitarian Workers

description: [Leadership] Senate President Godswill Akpabio has called on the Chinese government to increase aid flows to Africa, particularly Nigeria, as part of efforts to strengthen bilateral ties and foster development.
title: Africa: Akpabio Urges China to Boost Aid to Africa, Strengthen Ties With Nigeria

description: [WHO] The World Health Organization (WHO) and partners announced 10 projects that will receive almost US$ 2 million in grants to improve capacities in pathogen genomic surveillance.
title: Africa: International Pathogen Surveillance Network Announces First Recipients of Grants to Better Understand Disease Threats

description: [World Bank] STORY HIGHLIGHTS
title: Africa: Ujasiriamali - Self-Employment and Job Creation for Youth in Kenya

description: [VOA] Nairobi -- A new report from the Internal Displacement Monitoring Center says the number of people displaced in Africa has tripled to 35 million. Of these, 32.5 million abandoned their homes due to conflict and violence. The report, published Tuesday, says government efforts to address internal displacement on the continent have been commendable but not enough.
title: Africa: Africa Displacement Triples, Fueled By Conflict, Violence and Disasters, New Report States

description: [WHO-AFRO] Brazzaville -- Antimicrobial resistance (AMR) is one of the top global public health and development threats. About4.71 million deaths were linked to bacterial AMR in 2021 alone, with sub-Saharan Africa accounting for highest mortality rates. AMR could be responsible for up to 2 million deaths in Africa by 2050, underscoring the need for urgent action to protect health and save lives. Ifeyinwa George, a pharmacist and AMR programme manager at Dr Ameyo Stella Adadevoh (DRASA) Health Trust, a public health nonprofit in
title: Africa: Addressing the Challenges of Antimicrobial Resistance in Africa

description: [Interpol] Lyon -- Authorities across 19 African countries have arrested 1,006 suspects and dismantled 134,089 malicious infrastructures and networks thanks to a joint operation by INTERPOL and AFRIPOL against cybercrime.
title: Africa: Major  Cybercrime Operation Nets 1,006 Suspects

description: [UN News] Ahead of World AIDS Day on 1 December, a new report by the Joint UN Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS) highlights the critical role of human rights in ending the AIDS pandemic as a public health threat by 2030.
title: Africa: Upholding Human Rights Is Key to Ending Aids By 2030

description: [Africa Renewal] -- Renowned development economist, Carlos Lopes
title: Africa: Africa Must Help Shape an Inclusive Global Financial System

description: [IPS] As the world faces escalating challenges, from climate change to biodiversity loss and ecosystem degradation, there is now a rapidly expanding understanding that these crises are deeply interconnected.
title: Africa: Nature, Climate, and Prosperity - Unlocking the Power of Integrated Action

description: [VOA] Blantyre, Malawi -- A report by the international NGO Equality Now says the definition of rape in 25 African countries has allowed many perpetrators to go unpunished. Such narrow definitions, it says, often allow charges against accused rapists to be reduced to lesser crimes with lower penalties.
title: Africa: Report Exposes Legal Loopholes Protecting Rapists in Africa
